content: On November 27, 1991, the Atlanta Braves made a significant trade that would shape the future of the franchise. They acquired outfielder David Justice from the New York Yankees in exchange for pitcher Jim Clancy and minor league infielder Mike McCoy. Justice would go on to become a key player in the Braves' success during the early 1990s, including being a pivotal contributor to their 1995 World Series championship team.
